results.title: The Princess and the cobbler
results.creator_credit: Richard Williams, Richard Sutton, Imogen Sutton and Allied Filmmakers
results.brief_description: Set in a faraway land of magnificent palaces and beautiful Princesses, a sly thief, a shy cobbler and some very ugly brigands, do battle with an evil sorcerer to save a kingdom and rescue a beautiful princess. Following the tradition of “Aladdin” and “Ali Baba”, this animation is exciting family entertainment, with a wonderful musical score featuring the voices of Bobbi Page and Steve Lively, from “Beauty and the beast” and Vincent Price as the evil Zig Zag.

results.title: Total recall
results.creator_credit: Paul Verhoeven, Ronald Shusett, Buzz Feitshans, Carrolco and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Set in the year 2084, “Total Recall” tells the story of Doug Quaid who after having strange dream about Mars, visits a travel service called Rekall Inc. which implants artificial vacation memories into their clients’ brains. In Quaid’s case, the process goes horribly wrong and he discovers that his life on earth is an illusion, and that his real persona once lived on Mars. The film follows Quaid’s search for his identity and the unravelling of the mystery which surrounds his life. Starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Sharon Stone, Ronny Cox, this film has exceptional special effects, and is based on a story by renowned science fiction writer Phillip K. Dick.

results.title: Ride in the whirlwind
results.creator_credit: Monte Hellman, Jack Nicholson and Proteus Films
results.brief_description: When three innocent cowboys are mistaken for stagecoach robbers, they are forced to become fugitives until they clear themselves of suspicion. Before Jack Nicholson achieved fame in “Easy Rider”, his electrifying talent was evident as the writer, co-producer and star of this taut, highly charged western thriller. Co-starring Cameron Mitchell, Millie Perkins and Harry Dean Stanton.

results.title: They live
results.creator_credit: John Carpenter, Larry Franco and Alive Films
results.brief_description: Based on Ray Nelson’s short story “Eight o’clock in the morning”, this is a fantastically subversive film which uses the clever premise that those in control of the global economic power structure are other-worldly aliens. Masquerading as humans they are overpowering the Earth and its inhabitants with an hypnotic form of mind control - hidden subliminal messages in the mass media. Featuring state-of-the-art special effects and starring Roddy Piper, Keith David and Meg Foster, this fast-paced adventure hurtles the viewer into another dimension where all is not as it seems.

results.title: Schindler's list
results.creator_credit: Steven Spielberg, Branko Lustig, Gerald Molen, Amblin Entertainment and Universal City Studios Productions
results.brief_description: Staggering adaptation of Thomas Keneally’s novel of the same name about an Austrian businessman who, during the Second World War, saved 1,100 Polish Jews from Nazi slaughter by using them in his factory manufacturing crockery for the German Army. Filmed almost entirely on location in Poland in gritty monochrome, this is a brilliantly realised, fiercely controlled and restrained treatment of a true story. Harsh and compassionate, it avoids sentimentality until the end. The three central performances, Liam Neeson who is towering as Oskar Schindler, Ben Kingsley as his Jewish accountant and Ralph Fiennes as the odious Nazi Commandant Amon Goeth, are unforgettable. Winner of seven Academy Awards for: Best Picture of the Year, Best Achievement in Directing, Best Screenplay based on Material Previously Produced or Published, Best Achievement in Cinematography, Best Achievement in Film Editing, Best Achievement in Music, and Best Production Design.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Steven Spielberg, Branko Lustig, Gerald Molen, Amblin Entertainment and Universal City Studios Productions

results.title: Rambo III
results.creator_credit: Peter MacDonald, Buzz Feitshans and Carolco Pictures
results.brief_description: Considered by many critics to be the best of the three films in the Rambo: ‘First Blood trilogy.’ The film’s plot takes on a righteous turn as the “universal soldier” Rambo seeks to liberate a group of Afghans from under the regime of a brutal Russian General. The action sequences in this film are both spectacular and terrifying, and the enigmatic, not altogether two dimensional character of Rambo rises above the conflagration with more style than in the previous films.

results.title: Rambo: first blood. Part II
results.creator_credit: George Pan Cosmatos, Buzz Feitshans and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: Rambo is sent on a secret mission to help the U.S. Government find remaining Prisoners of War in Vietnam. However, although the mission is designed to fail, the bureaucrats did not take into account Rambo’s fierce determination, courage and skill to bring them back - alone if necessary. Rambo is launched into the jungle and the film explodes into one fireball action sequence after another.

results.title: First blood
results.creator_credit: Ted Kotcheff, Buzz Feitshans and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by David Morrell, “First Blood” began a trilogy of action films starring Sylvester Stallone as the tough but troubled Vietnam war veteran, John Rambo. Scarred from his horrific experiences in Vietnam, Rambo is abused by a power hungry “red-necked” sherriff in a small town who imprisons him. However, a caged Rambo is a dangerous beast and when he escapes the explosive action begins. Putting credibility aside, this is a prime example of the action movie genre which launched the careers of actors like Stallone, Schwarzenegger and Van Damme.

results.title: Frances
results.creator_credit: Graeme Clifford, Jonathan Sanger, Brooksfilms and EMI/Parlophone
results.brief_description: This is the story of Frances Farmer, whose troubled life made headlines in the 1930s. At 16, she was an award-winning high-school student in Seattle and at 23, a rising, provocative star of stage and screen, admired for her beauty and talent. At 27, a chain of relatively insignificant events led to her arrest and involuntary committal to a mental institution. Jessica Lange delivers a powerful, harrowing performance as the tormented Frances.

results.title: Eureka
results.creator_credit: Nicolas Roeg, Jeremy Thomas, Recorded Picture Company and J F Productions
results.brief_description: This is the dramatic story of the anticlimactic life of a greedy gold prospector after he has struck it rich. Gene Hackman performs with credit as a man whose jackpot fortune leaves him bored, surly and paranoid of being exploited by everybody, including his family. Jane Lapotaire plays his alcoholic wife and Theresa Russell his woman-daughter who rebelliously marries a man her father sees only as a merciless fortune hunter. This is an unforgettable tale of the illusory nature of power and the all-consuming violence of possession - whether it be of love or gold. Based on a book by Marshall Houts.
